awd_abstract_narration: Erskine College will initiate a four-week, residential Young                    Scholars project in Computer Interfacing and Biotechnology for 36               students entering grades 10-12.                                                                                                                                 18 students will develop expertise in computer interfacing and                  learn to apply this technology in the areas of meteorology, modern              physics, acoustics, chemistry, robotics and assistance for the                  disabled.  The other 18 students will develop expertise in                      biotechnology as they apply tissue culture and cloning to botany                and plant development, apply radiotelemetric to field studies of                the ecological zoology of small mammals and reptiles, and apply DNA             fingerprinting and genetic engineering to studies in molecular                  genetics.  Students will visit the Duke Power Nuclear Power Plant               and the IBM National Support Center for Persons with Disabilities.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
